title: Center of mass - mechanical arm-hand system

content.description: A team of engineers is designing a mechanical arm and hand to be used in a factory assembly line. As shown in the figure, the arm is <math alttext="0.60 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> long with a mass of <math alttext="1.0 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, while the hand is <math alttext="0.20 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> long with a mass of <math alttext="4.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"> <mn>4.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi>kg</mi> </math>. The arm and hand are each assumed to have a uniform density.
content.question: What is the distance from the shoulder to the center of mass of the arm-hand system?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
